Job Title: .NET Developer Our Architecture and Development Practice is interested in adding talented, experienced developers to its team. Slalom is seeking an Operations Analyst to support the end to end commercial and account operations at one of our anchor accounts. This person will be part of the core team supporting our Pharma clients. The Operations Analyst will work directly with the Account Management team having responsibilities in ensuring the account runs effectively and smoothly. In their role they will be responsible for managing certain recurring and ad hoc account operational activities. Primary areas of responsibility will include contract, invoice, and purchase order management, time management, and resource management. In addition to these core areas, the Operations Analyst will also support the account team and the broader leadership team in developing and executing the account strategy, defining and effectively using tools to support the operations of the account (e.g. SharePoint, Teams, Salesforce, ChangePoint, Workday), and managing the data that will help the account team make timely and effective decisions. Additional stretch areas, if the candidate is interested, might include managing marketing material and supporting marketing events on the account, support of sales activities including proposal development and curating reusable sales collateral, and project management to help organize the team and maintain progress on various internal initiatives. Under the direction of the account lead, the Operations Analyst detailed responsibilities may include any of the following, depending on the needs of the team. Who We Are Slalom is a modern consulting firm focused on strategy, technology, creativity and business transformation. We believe in what's possible and shape what's next. At Slalom, personal connection meets global scale. We build deep relationships with our clients in cities across the U.S., U.K., and Canada, while sharing insights across markets to bring the full breadth of Slalom's expertise to every engagement. Our seven regional Build Centers are hubs for innovation, attracting top talent to rapidly co-create the technology products of tomorrow. We also nurture strong partnerships with over 200 leading technology providers, including Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, Microsoft, Salesforce, and Tableau. Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Seattle, Slalom has organically grown to over 6,000 employees. We were named one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2018 and are regularly recognized by our employees as a best place to work! Experience Design at Slalom Experience design at Slalom is the art and science of crafting how something works and how users intact with it. Working alongside technical and project leadership, our experience design team is an integral part of client solutions from conceptualization to completion. creative-focused teams Intrinsic passion for learning new design skills, tools and technologies to enable precise design and creative process Experience overseeing projects on an agile-based Slalom has been asked to help a local biotech with the initial phase of rebuilding their Intranet.ï¿½ï¿½Their goal is to create a new home page, as well as design, build and migrate 4 specially selected departments into the new Intranet framework.ï¿½ï¿½They currently sit on O365, however their current ?Intranet? is nothing more than an unorganized mix of Site Collections with a lack of intuitive IA and inconsistent brand, hindering consistent use and causing team members to leverage other tools preventing collaboration organization-wide.ï¿½ï¿½Slalom will help define the new structure of a department and build out a correlating site design that will support this vision to be used for future department migrations.ï¿½ï¿½Slalom?s approach to this project will be to remain entirely out of the box within the new Modern SharePoint framework.ï¿½ï¿½If for any reason Slalom determines that the OOTB Modern framework will not meet the needs of the client, a ?Classic? Slalom is looking for an Agile - Subject Matter Expert - Coach to join a growing Technology Enablement practice in London. This includes every stage of adoption, from assessing current state to the introduction of Agile and employee education, to fostering teams and cultures that practice Agile, to sustaining Agile methodologies and continually offering strategies for improvement. You?ll use techniques that increase collaboration, predictability, transparency and promote a culture of experimentation and innovation. Agile Practitioner Overview As an Agile Practitioner, you are responsible for the planning, execution, and delivery of projects by using industry standard agile methods. Your job functions include handling client engagements and acquiring a deep understanding of Slalom?s delivery capabilities to provide solutions to a variety of business and technical challenges. Our Agile Practitioners work in multiple disciplines and multiple industries and should be able to build client knowledge and credibility quickly. This role requires a highly motivated individual who is comfortable with rapid changes in direction and environment. You should be customer oriented, results driven, and passionate about delivering creative quality services to delight customers. To be successful, you will need to work well in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment. We are seeking experienced Agile Practitioners who have been managing Agile/Scrum projects for a minimum of 3 years and can demonstrate logical and analytical problem solving as well as a rigorous approach to Agile methodologies to deliver enterprise level projects. Experience leading or supporting an organization through an agile transformation is a plus. You will demonstrate leadership and flexibility and are effective working with all levels of an organization including clients, team members, other managers and senior executives. Agile Practitioners are adaptable to new environments and self-starters who can create structure where there is ambiguity. Typical project areas include leading project inception, design sessions, daily stand-ups, iteration/sprint ceremonies, process or system improvements, system selection and implementation, product definition, development and launch, custom development and web enablement. Mastery of, and experience with, a formal Agile Methodology is required. It is helpful that you have project management experience with custom software development, corporate system implementations ? especially CRM and ERP, process change and E-Business and E-Commerce. Responsibilities Perform ongoing assessments of teams? agile maturity and support continuous improvement Nurture communities of practice (internally within Slalom and at the client) Partner with Product Owners to ensure vision, roadmap and personas are well-defined Help teams continuously reflect and improve, becoming more effective in their roles and increasing their predictability, teamwork and quality practices Ensure adherence to Agile methodology including sprint events (stand-ups, demos, retrospectives), road mapping, backlog management (definition, grooming, prioritization), sizing and task estimation and velocity tracking Facilitate all agile ceremonies such as: stand-ups, backlog grooming, estimation, sprint and release planning, demos, and scrum-of-scrums, and retrospectives Gather and maintain product requirements and functional requirements for product enhancements and new product launches Monitor and communicate key Agile performance metrics: burn-down, burn-up, cumulative flow, velocity and as required, traditional project management status and deliverables Responsible for collaborating with product owner/senior management on artifacts such as: product backlog, sprint backlog, sprint burn down, release burn down Run the overall performance and delivery of cross-functional teams. Skills/Qualifications 3+ years of direct Agile/Scrum experience in either a facilitator or product owner role 5+ years overall project management experience leading enterprise level projects through a full lifecycle 2+ years of consulting experience at a consulting firm (or 4+ years? experience at two or more employers and demonstrated leadership growth) Experience with managing projects in JIRA/Confluence/Grasshopper and driving the development and maintenance of tools, measurement, and best practices Experience with mentoring and training teams in all aspects of the standard Agile/Scrum processes Experience leading software development efforts for large scale web applications using Agile and Lean methodologies with in-house and outsourced teams A deep understanding of MVP and the ability to guide product development from inception to deployment One or more Agile certifications (e.g., CSM, CSPO, CSP, PSM, PSPO). SAFe certifications (SA, SP, and/or SPC) is a plus Slalom Is An Equal Opportunity Employer And All Qualified Applicants Will Receive Consideration For Employment Without Regard To Race, Color, Religion, Sex, National Origin, Disability Status, Protected Veteran Status, Or Any Other Characteristic Protected By Law.

User Experience Designer ? Mobile Operations ï¿½ï¿½ Company Description Alaska Airlines is one of the most respected names in aviation and flies throughout its namesake state and the Lower 48, as well as to Hawaii, Canada, Mexico, Costa Rica and Cuba. Our roots date to 1932 and are symbolized by the Alaska Native painted on the tails of our aircraft. Guided by what we call the "Alaska Spirit", we pride ourselves on providing a lifeline to remote communities while delivering renowned service to everyone we fly. This commitment has brought us national and international recognition. We've been honored with a variety of awards by readers of Travel + Leisure, Conde Nast Traveler, USA Today and others. Alaska, with Virgin America, is the premier airline for people on the West Coast, and together with its sister carrier Horizon Air, flies to more than 118 destinations. The two airlines are subsidiaries of Alaska Air Group Inc. (NYSE:ALK) with annual revenues exceeding $7 billion. Job Description You will be part of a team that is responsible for both creating and evolving the digital transformation of the front-line operation of Alaska Airlines. You are a forward-thinker, a rule breaker, and willing to challenge and provoke new ways of connecting with our airport Customer Service Agents (CSAs). You will be leading the charge in creating a mobile-first strategy for interacting with our customers to create an exceptional in-airport experience. As a user-experience designer, you will perform evaluative research to identify how our Agents are currently working with and using products developed by the mobile operations team. You will also analyze workflow tasks, develop task flows, produce wireframes and prototypes, as well as help define the visual style for our suite of digital products. This position requires strong organization and communication skills, and the ability to work collaboratively across related teams. You?ll also need to be deeply passionate about getting to know our CSAs, support our empathy for their work environment and needs, and help us create great product experiences for them while balancing the goals and requirements of the business. The candidate will work closely with a team of UX Researchers, Product Managers and Engineers in a mainly agile delivery environment. The User Experience Designer will report to the User Experience Manager. Alliances at Slalom are a little different to elsewhere and we are looking for an Alliance Manager to join the growing team. At Slalom we are passionate about people and believe in true partnership, whether that?s with our clients or our alliances. Like client relationships, alliance relationships for us shape the way we go to market and develop as a company. Our aim is to be the most impactful partner to each of our alliances. Together with our alliances, we love to help transform businesses. The Alliance Manager will work alongside cross-disciplinary leaders, be integral to our alliance relationships and grow our business by building pipeline and running client pursuits. You must possess a passion for technology consulting and have experience building and managing relationships with an alliance or client, and the proven success to manage sales opportunities. We are a growing UK business and want you to join us during this exciting time of growth. Working with our alliances, the Alliance Manager is the face of our business in the partner ecosystem, marketplace and communities. If this feels like you, we'd love to hear your story! We partner with companies to push the boundaries of what?s possible?together. Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Seattle, WA, Slalom has organically grown to nearly 4,000 employees. Job Title: Analytics Consultant Experience: Deliver transformative solutions to clients that are aligned to industry best practices and provide thought leadership in data space. Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities. Collaborate and enable business stakeholders with self-service analytics. Expert solution delivery using Tableau, Alteryx, and Microsoft BI. Working knowledge of Python and R. Highly self-motivated to deliver both independently and with strong team collaboration. Ability to creatively take on new challenges and work outside comfort zone. Strong written and oral communications along with presentation and interpersonal skills. Advanced knowledge of SQL, including ability to write stored procedures, triggers, analytic functions, and tuning. Knowledge of relational and dimensional database structures, theories, principles, and practices. Consulting experience. Conduct and lead white-boarding sessions, workshops, design sessions, and project meetings as needed, playing a key role in client relations. Understanding of AGILE project approaches and methodologies. Strong aptitude for learning new technologies and analytics techniques. They are looking for a QA lead to work with their Mortgage Loan Origination Team.ï¿½ï¿½They have a custom built new Mortgage LOS and need someone to help run regression testing and risk analysis for the current and new integrations associated with the LOS.ï¿½ï¿½ Start is immediate through end of year. BA skillset needed as well - this component comes in as their will be lots of cross team work dealing with BECU leaders as well as process documentation, mapping different workstreams, etc. ï¿½ï¿½Does this need to be someone with QA chops (knows how to write test automation) or if it can be a BA who knows test processes? ï¿½ï¿½ Understanding how automation comes into a QA strategy is needed, but they don?t need to know how to write test automation.ï¿½ï¿½ Is testing manual or is the need for someone who knows how to write test code/test automationï¿½ï¿½ - The project has both automated and manual testing components, however, this person does not need to know how to write or run automation .ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Will this person be writing and executing tests or only executing tests written by someone else ? High level role description from the client. Collaborates with business and technical stakeholders to define business processes by analyzing requirements, constructing process flow charts and diagrams and completing associated documentation.ï¿½ï¿½Ensures business process documentation meets all requirements. Documents business and systems procedures.ï¿½ï¿½ Assists in creating user reference documentation, training help desk support, and training users. Assists with all change management activities as required.

Billing Supervisor The Billing Supervisor is responsible for coordinating and supervising the client invoicing processes and related reporting and accounting tasks. The role oversees a team of regional billing analysts and takes responsibility for the work being performed consistently, accurately, timely, and with a high level of customer service excellence. This position reports to the Billing and AR Manager and requires excellent communication and collaboration skills, ability to evaluate and improve business processes, experience supervising and motivating others while managing their own work load, strong prioritization skills, and strong attention to detail. Responsibilities: Invoicing Management Supervise and execute the process of billing services and expenses to Slalom?s customers within a region Oversee the process of compiling expense receipts to support client invoices Lead the implementation and adoption of new processes, procedures, and initiatives Communicate effectively with invoice approvers and account team leadership Collaborate with other members of Accounting and Finance Communicate complex issues in a clear, concise, and audience-appropriate manner Maintain a high degree of customer service excellence while resolving invoicing issues Reporting and Analysis Create and monitor monthly unbilled receivable reports and resolve billing delays Create analysis to resolve complex invoicing issues impacting cross functional teams Support billing and financial statement audits and examinations Make appropriate decisions after gathering and analyzing necessary facts Escalate as appropriate for visibility and assistance Supervisory Experience Onboard and train employees Manage the employee hiring process - develop job descriptions and performance expectations, identify essential functions and required knowledge, skills, and abilities Manage several direct report employees and team performance, including coaching, counseling, motivating, and evaluating employees. Provide appropriate feedback for performance improvements and career development Qualifications: 8+ years of experience in finance/accounting required 3+ years of supervisory experience required Bachelor?s degree in an accounting related field preferred Strong interpersonal and communication skills Strong analytical skills and attention to detail Solid understanding of accounting and invoice activities Ability to evaluate contractual obligations and act independently to ensure proper client billing Ability to work cross functionally with sales and account management teams Ability to remain calm and professional under pressure Positive, relationship-oriented attitude and communication style Takes pride in quality and quantity of work produced Acts as a role model in support of new initiatives Seeks continual professional development Proficient at Microsoft Excel and an ability to pick up new systems Works well in an open-format environment Slalom is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
